trans-unit.source: Configure a custom domain name in Cloud Services
trans-unit.target: Configure a custom domain name in Cloud Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to expose your Azure application or data on a custom domain by configuring DNS settings.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to expose your Azure application or data on a custom domain by configuring DNS settings.

trans-unit.source: Configuring a custom domain name for an Azure cloud service
trans-unit.target: Configuring a custom domain name for an Azure cloud service

trans-unit.source: When you create a Cloud Service, Azure assigns it to a subdomain of cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Cloud Service, Azure assigns it to a subdomain of cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your Cloud Service is named "contoso", your users will be able to access your application on a URL like http://contoso.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your Cloud Service is named "contoso", your users will be able to access your application on a URL like http://contoso.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: Azure also assigns a virtual IP address.
trans-unit.target: Azure also assigns a virtual IP address.

trans-unit.source: However, you can also expose your application on your own domain name, such as contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: However, you can also expose your application on your own domain name, such as contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to reserve or configure a custom domain name for Cloud Service web roles.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to reserve or configure a custom domain name for Cloud Service web roles.

trans-unit.source: Do you already undestand what CNAME and A records are?
trans-unit.target: Do you already undestand what CNAME and A records are?

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Jump past the explaination</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Jump past the explaination</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The procedures in this task apply to Azure Cloud Services.
trans-unit.target: The procedures in this task apply to Azure Cloud Services.

trans-unit.source: For Websites, see <link><linkText>Configuring a Custom Domain Name for an Azure App Service Web App</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For Websites, see <link><linkText>Configuring a Custom Domain Name for an Azure App Service Web App</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For storage accounts, see <link><linkText>Configuring a Custom Domain Name for an Azure Storage Account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For storage accounts, see <link><linkText>Configuring a Custom Domain Name for an Azure Storage Account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Get going faster--use the NEW Azure <link><linkText>guided walkthrough</linkText><title></title></link>!
trans-unit.target: Get going faster--use the NEW Azure <link><linkText>guided walkthrough</linkText><title></title></link>!

trans-unit.source: It makes associating a custom domain name AND securing communication (SSL) with Azure Cloud Services or Azure Websites a snap.
trans-unit.target: It makes associating a custom domain name AND securing communication (SSL) with Azure Cloud Services or Azure Websites a snap.

trans-unit.source: Understand CNAME and A records
trans-unit.target: Understand CNAME and A records

trans-unit.source: CNAME (or alias records) and A records both allow you to associate a domain name with a specific server (or service in this case,) however they work differently.
trans-unit.target: CNAME (or alias records) and A records both allow you to associate a domain name with a specific server (or service in this case,) however they work differently.

trans-unit.source: There are also some specific considerations when using A records with Azure Cloud services that you should consider before deciding which to use.
trans-unit.target: There are also some specific considerations when using A records with Azure Cloud services that you should consider before deciding which to use.

trans-unit.source: CNAME or Alias record
trans-unit.target: CNAME or Alias record

trans-unit.source: A CNAME record maps a specific domain, such as contoso.com or www.contoso.com, to a canonical domain name.
trans-unit.target: A CNAME record maps a specific domain, such as contoso.com or www.contoso.com, to a canonical domain name.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the canonical domain name is the [myapp].cloudapp.net domain name of your Azure hosted application.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the canonical domain name is the [myapp].cloudapp.net domain name of your Azure hosted application.

trans-unit.source: Once created, the CNAME creates an alias for the [myapp].cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: Once created, the CNAME creates an alias for the [myapp].cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: The CNAME entry will resolve to the IP address of your [myapp].cloudapp.net service automatically, so if the IP address of the cloud service changes, you do not have to take any action.
trans-unit.target: The CNAME entry will resolve to the IP address of your [myapp].cloudapp.net service automatically, so if the IP address of the cloud service changes, you do not have to take any action.

trans-unit.source: Some domain registrars only allow you to map subdomains when using a CNAME record, such as www.contoso.com, and not root names, such as contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: Some domain registrars only allow you to map subdomains when using a CNAME record, such as www.contoso.com, and not root names, such as contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: For more information on CNAME records, see the documentation provided by your registrar, <link><linkText>the Wikipedia entry on CNAME record</linkText><title></title></link>, or the <link><linkText>IETF Domain Names - Implementation and Specification</linkText><title></title></link> document.
trans-unit.target: For more information on CNAME records, see the documentation provided by your registrar, <link><linkText>the Wikipedia entry on CNAME record</linkText><title></title></link>, or the <link><linkText>IETF Domain Names - Implementation and Specification</linkText><title></title></link> document.

trans-unit.source: A record
trans-unit.target: A record

trans-unit.source: An A record maps a domain, such as contoso.com or www.contoso.com, or a wildcard domain such as \*.contoso.com, to an IP address.
trans-unit.target: An A record maps a domain, such as contoso.com or www.contoso.com, or a wildcard domain such as \*.contoso.com, to an IP address.

trans-unit.source: In the case of an Azure Cloud Service, the virtual IP of the service.
trans-unit.target: In the case of an Azure Cloud Service, the virtual IP of the service.

trans-unit.source: So the main benefit of an A record over a CNAME record is that you can have one entry that uses a wildcard, such as \*.contoso.com, which would handle requests for multiple sub-domains such as mail.contoso.com, login.contoso.com, or www.contso.com.
trans-unit.target: So the main benefit of an A record over a CNAME record is that you can have one entry that uses a wildcard, such as \*.contoso.com, which would handle requests for multiple sub-domains such as mail.contoso.com, login.contoso.com, or www.contso.com.

trans-unit.source: Since an A record is mapped to a static IP address, it cannot automatically resolve changes to the IP address of your Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: Since an A record is mapped to a static IP address, it cannot automatically resolve changes to the IP address of your Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: The IP address used by your Cloud Service is allocated the first time you deploy to an empty slot (either production or staging.)
trans-unit.target: The IP address used by your Cloud Service is allocated the first time you deploy to an empty slot (either production or staging.)

trans-unit.source: If you delete the deployment for the slot, the IP address is released by Azure and any future deployments to the slot may be given a new IP address.
trans-unit.target: If you delete the deployment for the slot, the IP address is released by Azure and any future deployments to the slot may be given a new IP address.

trans-unit.source: Conveniently, the IP address of a given deployment slot (production or staging) is persisted when swapping between staging and production deployments or performing an in-place upgrade of an existing deployment.
trans-unit.target: Conveniently, the IP address of a given deployment slot (production or staging) is persisted when swapping between staging and production deployments or performing an in-place upgrade of an existing deployment.

trans-unit.source: For more information on performing these actions, see <link><linkText>How to manage cloud services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on performing these actions, see <link><linkText>How to manage cloud services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Add a CNAME record for your custom domain
trans-unit.target: Add a CNAME record for your custom domain

trans-unit.source: To create a CNAME record, you must add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using the tools provided by your registrar.
trans-unit.target: To create a CNAME record, you must add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using the tools provided by your registrar.

trans-unit.source: Each registrar has a similar but slightly different method of specifying a CNAME record, but the concepts are the same.
trans-unit.target: Each registrar has a similar but slightly different method of specifying a CNAME record, but the concepts are the same.

trans-unit.source: Use one of these methods to find the .cloudapp.net domain name assigned to your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Use one of these methods to find the .cloudapp.net domain name assigned to your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Login to the [Azure Preview Portal], select your cloud service, look at the Essentials section and then find the Site URL entry.
trans-unit.target: Login to the [Azure Preview Portal], select your cloud service, look at the Essentials section and then find the Site URL entry.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>quick glance section showing the site URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>quick glance section showing the site URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: OR
trans-unit.target: OR

trans-unit.source: Install and configure <link><linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:
trans-unit.target: Install and configure <link><linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:

trans-unit.source: Save the domain name used in the URL returned by either method, as you will need it when creating a CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: Save the domain name used in the URL returned by either method, as you will need it when creating a CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: Log on to your DNS registrar's website and go to the page for managing DNS.
trans-unit.target: Log on to your DNS registrar's website and go to the page for managing DNS.

trans-unit.source: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.
trans-unit.target: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.

trans-unit.source: Now find where you can select or enter CNAME's.
trans-unit.target: Now find where you can select or enter CNAME's.

trans-unit.source: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.
trans-unit.target: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.

trans-unit.source: You should look for the words CNAME, Alias, or Subdomains.
trans-unit.target: You should look for the words CNAME, Alias, or Subdomains.

trans-unit.source: You must also provide the domain or subdomain alias for the CNAME, such as www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.
trans-unit.target: You must also provide the domain or subdomain alias for the CNAME, such as www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create an alias for the root domain, it may be listed as the '@' symbol in your registrar's DNS tools.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create an alias for the root domain, it may be listed as the '@' symbol in your registrar's DNS tools.

trans-unit.source: Then, you must provide a canonical host name, which is your application's cloudapp.net domain in this case.
trans-unit.target: Then, you must provide a canonical host name, which is your application's cloudapp.net domain in this case.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following CNAME record forwards all traffic from www.contoso.com to contoso.cloudapp.net, the custom domain name of your deployed application:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following CNAME record forwards all traffic from www.contoso.com to contoso.cloudapp.net, the custom domain name of your deployed application:

trans-unit.source: Alias/Host name/Subdomain
trans-unit.target: Alias/Host name/Subdomain

trans-unit.source: Canonical domain
trans-unit.target: Canonical domain

trans-unit.source: www
trans-unit.target: www

trans-unit.source: contoso.cloudapp.net
trans-unit.target: contoso.cloudapp.net

trans-unit.source: A visitor of www.contoso.com will never see the true host
trans-unit.target: A visitor of www.contoso.com will never see the true host

trans-unit.source: (contoso.cloudapp.net), so the forwarding process is invisible to the
trans-unit.target: (contoso.cloudapp.net), so the forwarding process is invisible to the

trans-unit.source: end user.
trans-unit.target: end user.

trans-unit.source: The example above only applies to traffic at the www subdomain.
trans-unit.target: The example above only applies to traffic at the www subdomain.

trans-unit.source: Since you cannot use wildcards with CNAME records, you must create one CNAME for each domain/subdomain.
trans-unit.target: Since you cannot use wildcards with CNAME records, you must create one CNAME for each domain/subdomain.

trans-unit.source: If you want to direct traffic from subdomains, such as *.contoso.com, to your cloudapp.net address, you can configure a URL Redirect or URL Forward entry in your DNS settings, or create an A record.
trans-unit.target: If you want to direct traffic from subdomains, such as *.contoso.com, to your cloudapp.net address, you can configure a URL Redirect or URL Forward entry in your DNS settings, or create an A record.

trans-unit.source: Add an A record for your custom domain
trans-unit.target: Add an A record for your custom domain

trans-unit.source: To create an A record, you must first find the virtual IP address of your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: To create an A record, you must first find the virtual IP address of your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Then add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using the tools provided by your registrar.
trans-unit.target: Then add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using the tools provided by your registrar.

trans-unit.source: Each registrar has a similar but slightly different method of specifying an A record, but the concepts are the same.
trans-unit.target: Each registrar has a similar but slightly different method of specifying an A record, but the concepts are the same.

trans-unit.source: Use one of the following methods to get the IP address of your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Use one of the following methods to get the IP address of your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Login to the [Azure Preview Portal], select your cloud service, look at the Essentials section and then find the Public IP addresses entry.
trans-unit.target: Login to the [Azure Preview Portal], select your cloud service, look at the Essentials section and then find the Public IP addresses entry.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>quick glance section showing the VIP</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>quick glance section showing the VIP</linkText>

trans-unit.source: OR
trans-unit.target: OR

trans-unit.source: Install and configure <link><linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:
trans-unit.target: Install and configure <link><linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:

trans-unit.source: Save the IP address, as you will need it when creating an A record.
trans-unit.target: Save the IP address, as you will need it when creating an A record.

trans-unit.source: Log on to your DNS registrar's website and go to the page for managing DNS.
trans-unit.target: Log on to your DNS registrar's website and go to the page for managing DNS.

trans-unit.source: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.
trans-unit.target: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.

trans-unit.source: Now find where you can select or enter A record's.
trans-unit.target: Now find where you can select or enter A record's.

trans-unit.source: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.
trans-unit.target: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.

trans-unit.source: Select or enter the domain or subdomain that will use this A record.
trans-unit.target: Select or enter the domain or subdomain that will use this A record.

trans-unit.source: For example, select www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, select www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create a wildcard entry for all subdomains, enter '*'.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create a wildcard entry for all subdomains, enter '*'.

trans-unit.source: This will cover all sub-domains such as mail.customdomain.com, login.customdomain.com, and www.customdomain.com.
trans-unit.target: This will cover all sub-domains such as mail.customdomain.com, login.customdomain.com, and www.customdomain.com.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create an A record for the root domain, it may be listed as the '@' symbol in your registrar's DNS tools.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create an A record for the root domain, it may be listed as the '@' symbol in your registrar's DNS tools.

trans-unit.source: Enter the IP address of your cloud service in the provided field.
trans-unit.target: Enter the IP address of your cloud service in the provided field.

trans-unit.source: This associates the domain entry used in the A record with the IP address of your cloud service deployment.
trans-unit.target: This associates the domain entry used in the A record with the IP address of your cloud service deployment.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following A record forwards all traffic from contoso.com to 137.135.70.239, the IP address of your deployed application:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following A record forwards all traffic from contoso.com to 137.135.70.239, the IP address of your deployed application:

trans-unit.source: Host name/Subdomain
trans-unit.target: Host name/Subdomain

trans-unit.source: IP address
trans-unit.target: IP address

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates creating an A record for the root domain.
trans-unit.target: This example demonstrates creating an A record for the root domain.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to create a wildcard entry to cover all subdomains, you would enter '*' as the subdomain.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to create a wildcard entry to cover all subdomains, you would enter '*' as the subdomain.

trans-unit.source: IP addresses in Azure are dynamic by default.
trans-unit.target: IP addresses in Azure are dynamic by default.

trans-unit.source: You will probably want to use a <link><linkText>reserved IP address</linkText><title></title></link> to ensure that your IP address does not change.
trans-unit.target: You will probably want to use a <link><linkText>reserved IP address</linkText><title></title></link> to ensure that your IP address does not change.
